column4: hi. it seems there's a broken package that I tried to install via apt-get. now, whenever I try to install something else, I get a message saying I must configure 'sudo dkpg --configure -a'. But when I do that, it doesn't really configure the package. I can't install anything; apt-get just hangs on this broken package! please help
Have you tried removing the broken package?
yes, but it says I must install it first
What happens when you try install--reinstall?
Did you do apt-get update first?
I did update, then install --reinstall, and it still hangs
hmm.. not sure how it got that broken
with the same error about having no files installed
What did you do before it broke?
I was installing it via apt-get, and it was taking ages, so I killed it. it wasn't even responding to Ctrl+C, so I killed the terminal process it was on
I don't think we support mint here
ok, but this is a basic tool, unrelated to mint's higher-level changes
I tried apt-get clean, and now when I try apt-get install some other package, it's downloading the broken package again... well I'll see if it works
